The hackers focused on around seven "load dispatch" centres that disperse electricity in areas near the India-China border in Ladakh, it said. They reportedly compromised an Indian national emergency response system.

349.title: If Venkatesh didn't have Cummins at the other end, KKR would've lost: Jaffer
349.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer has said KKR would've lost to MI had Pat Cummins not smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history. "Venkatesh Iyer was finding it hard to time the ball even though he got fifty. If Iyer didn't have Cummins at the other end, KKR might not have won," he stated. Cummins scored 56* off 15 against MI.

350.title: E-commerce firm JD.com's founder steps down as CEO after 19 yrs
350.article_body: Chinese e-commerce giant JD.com's Founder Richard Liu has stepped down as the CEO of the firm after 19 years. Company president Lei Xu has been appointed as the new CEO. Liu will stay on as chairman of the Beijing-headquartered firm. Xu, who has been at the firm for over 10 years, will also join the board as an executive director.

351.title: Mumbai woman trying to file complaint against auto driver loses ₹1 lakh
351.article_body: A 51-year-old Mumbai woman lost nearly ₹1 lakh while trying to register complaint against an auto driver. The woman was left midway by the auto driver, following which she began looking for the cab aggregator's customer care number and contacted a fraudulent number, police said. However, on pretext of providing a refund, the executive siphoned off money from her account.

352.title: 60% of Delhi traffic police personnel suffer from hypertension: Report
352.article_body: Nearly 60% of the 5,500 traffic police personnel in Delhi suffer from hypertension, according to reports of their medical check-ups conducted in February this year. Further, 20% of them have diabetes while 10% have hearing problems, the reports added. Direct exposure to air and noise pollution, job stress and irregular sleep were cited as reasons for these medical conditions.

353.title: Ex-police officer alleges attack by car recovery agents in Ahmedabad
353.article_body: Retired SP, Narendra K Amin, filed a police complaint in Ahmedabad claiming that he was allegedly attacked by four recovery agents who claimed to be from the crime branch and tried to seize his car. Amin also accused his two former business associates of fraud. He claimed that the car was under Preeti Dalal's name, his former business associate.

354.title: Haryana Education Minister should be sacked: Surjewala on paper leak
354.article_body: After reports that five question papers of the Haryana Board's Class 10 and 12 were leaked, Congress General Secretary Randeep Singh Surjewala demanded the removal of Haryana Education Minister Kanwar Pal. Surjewala criticised the Haryana government, saying that Khattar-Chautala government is responsible for "ruining" the education system in the state and making students dependent on the "copying mafia".

355.title: Married 3 months ago, Guj man killed for objecting to comments on wife
355.article_body: Shabbir Lalpariya from Gujarat, who got married three months ago, was stabbed to death after he got into fight as four men teased his wife. Prime accused Zuber's cousin brother Mohsin passed objectionable comments at Shabbir's wife, after which Shabbir and Mohsin got into argument. Later, Zuber slapped Shabbir in Chandni Bazaar, where Shabbir was also stabbed multiple times.

356.title: Russia must not win the war against Ukraine: German Chancellor
356.article_body: Addressing the lawmakers in the federal Parliament, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Wednesday said, "It has to remain our goal that Russia does not win this war [against Ukraine]." Speaking of the reported war crimes by Russian forces, Scholz said, "The perpetrators and those who commissioned them have to be held accountable."

357.title: We got behind in first 10 overs while batting: MI coach Jayawardena
357.article_body: Talking about their defeat against KKR, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said they knew it'll be "hard to work through" the initial overs but they took a little more time to establish themselves as they kept losing wickets. "I thought we built it up nicely...[but then] got behind in first 10 overs," he added. MI were 54/2 after 10 overs.

358.title: Pune witnesses hottest day of year at 40.1°C
358.article_body: Pune on Wednesday witnessed its hottest day of the year at 40.1 degrees Celsius. As per the forecast of the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the city will experience similar hot days ahead this week. Reportedly, the minimum temperatures in Pune have remained between 18 and 26 degrees Celsius, which were significantly above normal for April.

359.title: US man who lived in daughter's dorm convicted of abusing her friends
359.article_body: A 62-year-old US man, Lawrence Ray, was convicted of exploiting his daughter's college friends for years by using threats and violence to make himself rich. Ray met the students when he moved into his daughter's dorm in a New York college after completing a prison stint. Found guilty on 15 counts, the convict faces life in prison.

360.title: Boy kills father over fear of being 'thrown out' if he fails in exams in MP
360.article_body: A 15-year-old boy killed his 46-year-old father with an axe over the fear of being "thrown out" if he fails in Class 10 exams in Madhya Pradesh's Guna, police said. He burnt his fingers so that his fingerprints on the axe don't match, police added. The boy had not prepared for the exams and feared failing, police further said.

361.title: Asked to stop spitting, man assaults 18-yr-old on Thane local
361.article_body: A 33-year-old man allegedly beat up an 18-year-old boy after the teenager asked him to stop spitting from the footboard of Titwala-bound local train in Thane on Tuesday. The man started assaulting the teenager on the moving train for teaching him cleanliness. Later, he got down at next station and beat up the boy again with a stone, police said.

362.title: Warren Buffett's Berkshire reveals 11.4% stake in HP worth $4.2 bn
362.article_body: Billionaire Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway has disclosed its purchase of nearly 121 million shares of HP, giving it a roughly 11.4% stake worth about $4.2 billion. HP shares jumped nearly 10% to $38.38 in after-hours trading after Berkshire disclosed the stake in SEC filings. In March, Berkshire agreed to buy insurance company Alleghany for $11.6 billion in cash.

363.title: After Delhi, Punjab, it’s Himachal’s turn to see a revolution: Kejriwal
363.article_body: After Delhi and Punjab, it’s Himachal Pradesh’s turn to bring in a revolution, AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal said on Wednesday. Kejriwal and Punjab CM  Bhagwant Mann led a roadshow in Himachal’s Mandi ahead of state Assembly polls. "We don't know how to do politics but we certainly know how to build schools and hospitals and eradicate corruption," Kejriwal added.

364.title: Simon Doull clarifies his 'social media star' statement on RR's Riyan Parag
364.article_body: Commentator Simon Doull clarified after a Twitter user criticised him for saying, "I know [RR all-rounder] Riyan Parag is a social media star...but that doesn't count in a match." "Social media says...he's popular...but that doesn't count when he's in...middle...Runs and strike rate is his currency and IMO it's not good enough. Maybe it's lost in translation a little...sorry," Doull wrote.

365.title: Won't fill petrol for less than ₹50: Maharashtra petrol pump's notice amid rising prices
365.article_body: A petrol pump in Maharashtra's Nagpur has refused to sell petrol for less than ₹50 amid rising prices. "It's not viable to operate machines for giving such...small quantity of petrol as they consume high electricity. We took this decision to avoid...scuffle," the petrol pump owner said. "When drivers ask for petrol worth ₹20-₹30...machine hits the amount within seconds," he added.

366.title: Ensured to not go overboard, Madhuri can't look vulgar: Indra on 'Dhak Dhak..'
366.article_body: 'Beta' director Indra Kumar said that the team ensured that they do not go overboard with the song 'Dhak Dhak Karne Laga'. "The idea [was] it should not be vulgar...And we succeeded. Families  watched it together....We ensured that we should not go overboard. Madhuri [Dixit] anyway is so graceful. She can't ever look vulgar, " Indra added.

367.title: 33-year-old man held with mephedrone worth ₹27.2 lakh in Pune
367.article_body:
Police have arrested a 33-year-old man with at least 272 grams of mephedrone worth ₹27.2 lakh in Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad. The accused, Nadim Inayat Patel, was reportedly intercepted by police at Sudhavadi in Maval on Tuesday at 11:15 pm, following a tip-off. Along with the contraband, police 
also seized a four-wheeler vehicle and two cell phones from the accused.

368.title: India sends 270,000 MT of petrol, diesel to Sri Lanka amid its economic crisis
368.article_body: India has supplied more than 270,000 MT of petrol and diesel to Sri Lanka so far under a credit line to help ease the power crisis amid the country's worst economic crisis in decades. "One consignment each of 36,000 MT petrol and 40,000 MT diesel was delivered to SriLanka in the last 24 hours," India High Commission in Colombo tweeted.

369.title: Man who bought NFT of world's first-ever tweet for $2.9 mn is reselling it for $48 mn
369.article_body: A non-fungible token (NFT) of the world's first-ever tweet is being resold for $48 million. The tweet, which read "just setting up my twttr", was sent by Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey in 2006. Malaysia-based Sina Estavi, CEO of blockchain service Bridge Oracle purchased the NFT for $2.9 million in March 2021. Estavi said he'd donate 50% of proceeds to charity.

370.title: AAP Youth Wing leader arrested for assaulting policemen in Gujarat
370.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) Youth Wing leader Yuvrajsinh Jadeja was arrested for allegedly assaulting policemen and dragging a constable on his car's bonnet in Gujarat's Gandhinagar, police said. "We had detained 55 Vidyasahayak recruitment protesters ...Jadeja had followed them...assaulted policemen present over there," police added. "BJP government framed him in a fake case," Gujarat AAP chief said.

371.title: Extraordinary! I couldn't believe the way Cummins was hitting: Shreyas
371.article_body: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said he couldn't believe the way pacer Pat Cummins was hitting the ball during their match against MI, which they won by five wickets. "Extraordinary!...because in the nets, he was getting bowled now and then," added Shreyas. "The plan was for Venkatesh to drop anchor and tell Pat to just swing at everything," he further said.

372.title: Haryana man kills 13-yr-old daughter over suspicion of love affair
372.article_body: A man allegedly strangulated his 13-year-old daughter in Haryana's Sonepat over suspicion of her affair with a man from the same village. "The girl's father claimed...she died after falling from stairs," said Sonepat Sadar SHO Deepti Garg. "The autopsy revealed...there were injury marks on the girl's body and she died due to strangulation. We have arrested the father," she added.

373.title: BEST starts AC bus services between T1, T2 of Mumbai airport
373.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electricity Supply and Transport (BEST) will be running AC bus services between Terminal 1 and Terminal 2 of Mumbai Airport from today. The bus service will be available 24 hours, at a frequency of 20- 30 minutes depending on the air traffic, officials said. The bus charges will be fixed at ₹50 for each trip, inclusive of luggage.

374.title: MNS leaders give 4-day ultimatum to remove loudspeakers from Pune mosques
374.article_body: Days after MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of loudspeakers from mosques, party leaders have given Pune Police a 4-day ultimatum to remove loudspeakers from city mosques. "We had given an ultimatum to Pune police to remove loudspeakers from mosques...If the police fail to do so, we will play Hanuman Chalisa in front of mosques," MNS leader Hemant Sambhus said.

375.title: Trains running slower than expected, punctuality declined: CAG
375.article_body: The travel time of trains has increased and punctuality declined, said a Comptroller and Auditor General (CAG) report tabled in Parliament. "The punctuality of mail/express trains over IR declined from 79% (2012-13) to 69% (2018-19)," said the report. It added that 123 out of 478 superfast trains ran at slower speeds than the specified 55 kmph.

376.title: Suspected Chinese hackers targeted India's power grid to collect data: Report
376.article_body: Suspected China-backed hackers have targeted India's power grids in the recent months under an apparent cyber-espionage campaign, Recorded Future reported. The hackers targeted at least seven "load dispatch" centres responsible for operations for grid control and electricity dispersal. The hacking group, TAG-38, used a malicious software which has previously been associated with China's PLA.

377.title: Pune woman's stalker attacks her neighbour after being rejected, held
377.article_body: A 24-year-old delivery boy in Pune who was stalking a 19-year-old woman attacked her 39-year-old neighbour with a sharp weapon after the woman asked him to leave her alone several times. Police said that the accused and the woman knew each other. The woman's grandmother had called the neighbours for help after accused threatened to harm the woman.

378.title: I thought we had the game till the 15th over: Rohit on defeat vs KKR
378.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma said he thought they had the game till the 15th over of KKR's innings during their match on Wednesday night. "Never expected Cummins to come and play like that...It'll be hard to digest," he added. KKR were 127/5 after 15 overs when Cummins scored 35 runs in the 16th over to chase down MI's 162-run target.

379.title: Ludhiana man suspected to be kidnapper helps 4-yr-old reunite with family
379.article_body: A man, suspected to be the kidnapper of a four-year-old based on CCTV footage, turned out to be a Good Samaritan and helped her reunite with her parents in Ludhiana. The girl went missing after losing her way while playing outside her mother's workplace. The man found her, posted her picture on Facebook and urged netizens to find her parents.

380.title: Citizens group wants Bengaluru’s Cubbon Park declared 'no-honking zone'
380.article_body: A citizen group called Citizens for Citizens (C4C), in collaboration with Mount Carmel College students, launched an awareness campaign at Cubbon Park on Tuesday, urging people to avoid mindless honking. The volunteers requested police to notify the Cubbon Park area as a honking-free/silence zone. The request in this regard has been submitted to Rajender Kataria, Principal Secretary (Transport).

381.title: Mumbai man loses ₹1.86 lakh in sextortion, male escort fraud case
381.article_body: A 30-year-old Mumbai-based man lost ₹1.86 lakh in two cheating cases. He lost ₹60,000 in a sextortion racket in which two females, after befriending him on Facebook, got involved in obscene acts over video calls and later, threatened him of posting the videos online. The victim also lost ₹1.26 lakh in a fake advertisement online which provided male escort jobs.

382.title: KTR inaugurates Wipro manufacturing facility in Hyd's Maheshwaram
382.article_body: Telangana Minister for Municipal Administration and Urban Development KT Rama Rao, along with Minister for Education Sabitha Reddy and Wipro group founder Azim Premji, inaugurated a Wipro manufacturing facility in Hyderabad's Maheshwaram on Tuesday. "Wipro has invested ₹300 crore to set up their facility and is creating direct and indirect employment for about 900 people," KTR tweeted.

383.title: 17-yr-old girl falls off cliff while trying to take selfie in Thane
383.article_body: Police have launched a search for a 17-year-old girl who fell from a cliff in Thane on Wednesday afternoon. The girl, identified as Damini Dinkarrao, had gone to Gorakhgad with her friends on a trek. "While they were coming down...she was clicking selfies from the edge of the mountain and accidentally fell from around 60 feet height," an officer said.

384.title: MakeMyTrip launches Great Summer Travel Sale from 7th-12th April
384.article_body: Aiming to help travellers make the most of the upcoming travel season, MakeMyTrip has launched the Great Summer Travel Sale from 7-12 April with offers like up to 20% off on domestic flights, up to ₹15,000 off on international flights and up to 30% off on domestic and international hotels & homestays. Offers on other travel options are also available.

385.title: Not nominated for award probably because I'm boring; don't drink, smoke: Tijori
385.article_body: Filmmaker Deepak Tijori said it doesn't "hurt him" to not have won an award. "I have not even...been nominated till date...I guess probably because I've not been social animal. I don't drink, I don't smoke. I am boring, vegetarian man!" he added. He further said he played a role in 'Baadshah' as he had a good equation with the director.

386.title: Pat diye chakke: Shah Rukh Khan as Cummins slams joint-fastest IPL fifty to help KKR win
386.article_body: KKR owner Shah Rukh Khan took to Instagram to praise his team following their win against MI. "Wow again...@patcummins30 I want to dance like @ar12russell and hug you like the whole team did," he wrote. "Wow...well done KKR and what else is there to say! 'Pat' diye chakke!" he added. Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest IPL fifty off 14 deliveries.

387.title: Rohit says 'Awaaz badhao yaar' in frustration during post-match interview, video viral
387.article_body: A video of MI captain Rohit Sharma saying 'Awaaz badhao yaar uska thoda (Increase his volume)' during post-match interview following their defeat against KKR has gone viral. "This pretty much explains the result," a fan tweeted. "This will be hard to digest how it turned out to be in the last couple of overs," Rohit later said in the interview.

388.title: Amnesty Int’l asks India to revoke travel ban on Aakar Patel
388.article_body: Amnesty International has asked the Indian government to revoke what it called an "arbitrary travel ban" imposed on author Aakar Patel. This comes after Patel, former chief of Amnesty India, was stopped from flying to US at Bengaluru airport. The global human rights body said the action against Patel shows India's "mounting crackdown on human rights defenders and activists".

389.title: MI's Daniel Sams bowls most expensive over of IPL 2022
389.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) fast bowler Daniel Sams bowled the most expensive over of IPL 2022 so far against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) after conceding 35 runs in his third over of the match on Wednesday. Sams was hit for four sixes and two fours by Pat Cummins. He also bowled a no-ball, on which Cummins scored two runs.

390.title: Performed 'Khuda..' climax in boarding school, said 'Dad has done it': Abhishek
390.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan said that he used to perform the climax of 'Khuda Gawah' in boarding school. "My friends, who were all foreigners...used to think I am a freak because I used to put on that climax, and perform it...I told them my dad has done it...they were very encouraging but...must have thought 'what is he doing?'," Abhishek added.

391.title: DTC bus catches fire in Delhi's Mahipalpur, shops gutted
391.article_body: A Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) bus caught fire in the Mahipalpur area on Wednesday and a few shops near it were also gutted, officials said. No casualty was reported, officials added. The bus was running past its annual maintenance contract, officials further said. "The bus...plying on Route No. 534/39 was burnt due to smoke from its engine," DTC said.

392.title: Father sells newborn baby for ₹1 lakh in Delhi; held along with 5 others
392.article_body: Delhi Police have recovered a newborn baby after he was kidnapped and arrested six persons, including his father, in connection with the case. Police said, "The [baby's father]...was facing losses in...business and wanted to sell his child to earn money...He was paid around ₹1 lakh." Police said the accused allegedly kidnapped the infant after spiking his mother's food with sedatives.

393.title: BMTC launches digital passes for passengers to travel in B'luru buses
393.article_body: The Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation has launched mobile-based digital passes for bus passengers. People have to buy the BMTC's daily, weekly and monthly passes through the mobile application Tummoc and they've to show it on their mobile phone to the conductor. The digital pass will be generated along with a unique ID, validity and dynamic QR code, an official said.

394.title: First-ever ODI hundred was scored in the second ODI
394.article_body: ODI cricket's first-ever hundred was scored by England's Dennis Amiss in the second ODI against Australia in August 1972, a year after the first-ever ODI. Amiss, born on April 7, 1943, scored the hundred off 130 balls in what was his debut match. He also shared the first-ever ODI hundred partnership, adding 125 runs with Keith Fletcher in the match.

395.title: Present evidence doesn't suggest presence of 'XE' variant: Govt on reports of 1st case
395.article_body: After reports confirmed India's first case of 'XE' variant in Mumbai, government said present evidence doesn't suggest the presence of the new variant. "FastQ files in respect of the sample were analysed in detail by genomic experts of INSACOG who have inferred that the genomic constitution of this variant doesn't correlate with...genomic picture of 'XE' variant," government added.

396.title: Cummins smashes joint-fastest fifty in IPL as KKR hand MI their 3rd straight defeat
396.article_body: KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history as KKR handed MI their third straight defeat in IPL 2022. Cummins reached the 50-run mark off 14 deliveries, equalling the record of KL Rahul, who had scored a 14-ball fifty against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2018. KKR chased down the 162-run target in 16 overs.

397.title: Cummins smashes joint-fastest fifty in IPL as KKR hand MI their 3rd straight defeat
397.article_body: KKR's Pat Cummins smashed the joint-fastest fifty in IPL history as KKR handed MI their third straight defeat in IPL 2022. Cummins reached the 50-run mark off 14 deliveries, equalling the record of PBKS captain KL Rahul, who had scored a 14-ball fifty against Delhi Capitals in IPL 2018. KKR chased down the 162-run target in 16 overs.

398.title: NEET exam to be held on July 17, JEE (Main) postponed to June & July
398.article_body: The National Testing Agency (NTA) said on Wednesday that the NEET examination will be held on July 17 while JEE (Main) 2022 examinations have been rescheduled to give students across the nation more time to prepare. The JEE Session 1 examination will be held from June 20-29 while Session 2 examination will be held from July 21-30, the notification read.

399.title: Kourtney Kardashian shares pics from her Las Vegas wedding with Travis Barker
399.article_body: Kourtney Kardashian, taking to Instagram, shared pictures from her wedding with Travis Barker in Las Vegas. "After an epic night and a little tequila, a queen and her handsome king ventured out to the only open chapel with an Elvis and got married (with no license)," Kourtney captioned the post. The duo got married hours after the Grammys 2022 ceremony.

400.title: Le Tissier leaves ambassador role at Southampton after Ukraine tweet
400.article_body: Matt Le Tissier on Wednesday announced he is resigning from his role as ambassador for Southampton after receiving backlash over sharing a conspiracy theory regarding the killings of civilians in Bucha by Russian troops. Le Tissier suggested the media had "lied" about the killings, before deleting the post. Le Tissier had served as an official ambassador for Southampton since 2019.

401.title: We will not be going near there: Liverpool's Klopp on Haaland transfer
401.article_body: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp on Wednesday said he will not try to sign Borussia Dortmund striker Erling Haaland during the summer transfer window. "The figures being mentioned out there are crazy. We have nothing to do with them. No chance," the former Dortmund manager said. The cost to buy the 21-year-old in a multi-year deal could reportedly exceed €300 million.

402.title: India sent over 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka in last 24 hours
402.article_body: In the last 24 hours, India has sent nearly 76,000 MT of fuel to Sri Lanka, which is seeing a power crisis. "One consignment each of 36,000 MT petrol and 40,000 MT diesel was delivered...in the last 24 hours. Total supply of various types of fuel under Indian assistance...stands at more than 270,000 MT," Indian Embassy in Sri Lanka revealed.

403.title: George Russell optimistic Mercedes can 'overtake' Ferrari, Red Bull
403.article_body: George Russell is optimistic that Mercedes can "overtake" Ferrari and Red Bull to fight for the Formula One world championship this season. "It's a very long season, I think we've all got confidence that if we do things right, there's no reason why we can't close the gap and potentially overtake [Ferrari and Red Bull]," Russell said.

404.title: BJP world's largest party, earned faith of crores of people: BJP leader
404.article_body: Senior BJP leader Murli Manohar Joshi on Wednesday said, "BJP is not just country's but world's largest party. It has earned the faith of crores of people, presented them with a different ideology." He further added, "It should now focus on bringing solutions to problems arising out of present-day needs." BJP celebrated its 42nd Foundation Day on April 6.
